thread.title: Stoke by-election: Nigel Farage will NOT be at vote as scandal ‘tearing Ukip apart'
thread.title_full: Stoke by-election: Nigel Farage will NOT be at vote as scandal ‘tearing Ukip apart'

title: Stoke by-election: Nigel Farage will NOT be at vote as scandal ‘tearing Ukip apart'
text:
The campaign has not been handled well at all and the constant back-biting by some members is tearing the party apart Ukip source 
Party sources revealed Mr Farage is in Washington this week hosting a variety of meetings with influencers as he takes his attention away from domestic matters. 
A source said: "The past few weeks have been toxic for the party and Nigel is concerned about the lack of unity. 
"He had a number of engagements that he's chosen to honour in the US, and felt it was important to focus on those as opposed to the by-election in Stoke. GETTY Mr Farage is not in Stoke to help an embattled Paul Nuttall 
"The campaign has not been handled well at all and the constant back-biting by some members is tearing the party apart." 
Party sources fear Mr Nutall could lose out on the Stoke Central seat he covets as a result of a series of smear campaigns. 
Mr Nuttall has refused to be interviewed by the press after it was alleged he had falsely claimed he was at the Hillsborough disaster, which he has strenuously denied. 
Voters will go to the ballot box in Stoke today amid an ugly election battle. 
The Labour candidate Gareth Snell has been embroiled in a series of scandals after it was revealed he was a Twitter troll. 
A number of foul tweets he posted were uncovered last week in which he used vulgar language to attack political opponents. 
One of those abused by the Labour activist was former Conservative party chairman Grant Shapps who told Express.co.uk that the comments were unacceptable. Nigel Farage: Man of many faces Fri, May 8, 2015
